page.title: 01Summary Of The Area.
page.content: Cowdray and St Andrews Avenues were Colchesters' by-pass.They take less traffic since the A12 now by-passes Colchester.In Colchester there are lots of cream and maroon buses.The farthest they go North is Mile End, East is Wivenhoe,South is Blackheath. Through Colchester flows the river Colne.It is the lowest bridging point before it becomes tidal.One industrial area in our part of Colchester is near East Gates,another is beside Cowdray Avenue.The Siege House,dating back to before 1648,has little discs on its walls which mark 15th century bullet holes.There is one very large secondary school in our area.There is still a large amount of farmland to the north and east but large areas are being developed for housing at Longridge Park and High Woods.
